alert.note: Alert for Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 10:57AM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW EXPECTED TO RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS TONIGHT... .A fast moving storm system will sweep across the region tonight. Snow from the storm will begin in central and north-central Wisconsin toward evening, and then quickly spread east across the rest of the region. The snow could fall quite heavily for a couple hours during the evening, then will diminish to light snow and drizzle or freezing drizzle after midnight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 6 inches. * WHERE...Vilas County. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 6 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will fall this evening. Somewhat of a lull in the snowfall may occur late tonight into Friday morning, then snow showers off Lake Superior will begin affecting the area.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
